comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: They appear to have been participants in the Beaux Arts Society's Venetian Pageant at the Hotel Astor. New York Times story, February 21, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9D03E0DF163AE6...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Thank you for the research into this interesting event! We will add more details when we update the descriptive information.

comment.author: 69761059@N08
comment._content: Yes, Mrs. Austin Lord was the mother of Gertrude Lord (1892-1982). Gertrude was my paternal grandmother. She married Carl Schmitt (1889-1989), a painter, in 1918, and they had 10 children (my father among them). Carl Schmitt was a founding member of the Silvemine Guild of Artists in 1922 (now the Silvermine Arts Center in New Canaan, CT). You can find out more at www.carlschmitt.org. Thank you for posting this.

comment.author: 34432309@N05
comment._content: I have a painting by Gertrude Lord hanging in my home.  I wish I knew more about her.
